newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends lower in kerb, seen falling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends lower in kerb, seen falling.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended 0.05 down at 41.15 to the dollar in the kerb market on Friday on increased buying of the U.S. currency, dealers said.
They said dollars were in demand after Finance Minister Sartaj Aziz told parliament on Thursday that a marginal devaluation of the rupee was on the cards.
The rupee was likely to open lower on Saturday, one dealer said. The State (central) bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on October 22, was 40.1200/40.3206 to the dollar.
The premium on the foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 2.60 percent compared to the opening at 2.70 percent.
